title: LIFE OF
name: Venkateswara Rao Tallam

events.title: Birthplace
events.content: Born to Smt Venkata Subbamma & Shri Venkata Pitchayya @Rajahmundry. They hailed from Guntur and had establised a brass and graphite-crucible industry.

events.title: Graduation
events.content: Successfully completed Biology in intermediete but failed to get a medicine seat. Took a change in track and got into B.Sc.Geology for further studies. Simultaneosly completed typewriting higher in Telugu, English and Hindi along with Stenography.

events.title: Post Graduation
events.content: Got PG admission in applied Geology in Andhra University Campus (Vishakapatnam) where he had nurtuted and moulded as a mature person.

events.title: Vasavi Business Centre
events.content: Got an oppurtunity to start a unique business having all types of communications and reprographics under one roof at Daba Gardens (Vishakapatnam).

events.title: Aqua Culture (Tiger Prawns)
events.content: While running Businness Cente in Vizag, got into Aqua Culture in Mallavaram (Near Yanam, East Godavari Dist) to an extent of 100 acres with two partners.

events.title: Marriage
events.content: Married the love of his life Sridevi on 22nd December in Vishakapatnam with blessings of many.

events.title: Children
events.content: Blessed with a boy (Kumar Kaushik) in 1998 and a girl (Nandita) in 1999.

events.title: Timber India
events.content: Shifted in the month of March (2004) to hyderabad to take over a Timber Saw Mill which was established in the year 1998.

events.title: Rainbow Estates
events.content: Together with university classmates and other investors, had started selling plots and developing the acquired lands in Bhimili area (Visakhapatnam).

events.title: Maitreya Minerals
events.content: While doing Timber and Real Estate, took a share in a Quartz mine near Chejerla Dist, Piduguralla, Guntur Dist which is the biggest quartz mine in Andhra Pradesh.

events.title: Nandita Timbers
events.content: Started import of Timber from various regions like Africa (Nigeria, Ivory Coast, Ghana, etc), America (Equador, Panama, Boullevia and Coastarica) and also from Malasia.

events.title: Nandita Mines & Minerals
events.content: Being a technocrat and passionate in mining, he took a chance to enter in acquisition of Mines and bought first land having Black Collor Granite mineral. Applied for permissions to start mining and also submitted applications for mineral reserves belonging to government in several parts of Andhra Pradesh and Telangana.

events.title: Nandita Granites
events.content: Acquired running establishment of Tan Brown Granite Quarry and started exploration of Rough Granite blocks.

events.title: Nandita Enterprises Pvt Ltd.
events.content: While doing the activities of Quarrying, Imports and Exports, he separated Imports and Exports and started doing under the banner of this company and acquired two more Black Granite Mines in Warangal.

events.title: Cancer Diagnosis
events.content: Diagnosed with Right Parietal Glioblastoma in 2018, after which undergone brain surgeries in 2019 and 2021 along with various other chemo and radiation therapies at KIMS Hospital.

events.title: Demise
events.content: Expired on 7th of July, 2022 while battling the tumor growth.

afternote: “He had started this journey with nothing in his pocket and had established a name for himself that will be remembered for years to come. He touched the lives of many people in his life including his family, friends, business associates, employees and several others. He never backed down and was always present when someone he knew needed help of any sort. He was passionate, compassionate, soft-spoken, loving and caring. All of this was possible because he had a personality and a charm that always garnered unwavering support and respect from anyone and everyone that ever encountered him. He had a ton of confidence and willpower in everything that he ever did, which also helped him fight cancer for more than three years. He had a wonderful adventure filled with passion and love, and now he rests in peace, watching from above, all that he had built and left behind. The void that is now in his place can never ever be filled and he will always be remembered as a caring husband, a loving father, a passionate businessman, a helping hand and a leader.”
